Homeowner Talk‑Track: Eight Steps

Comfort • Quiet • Costs | Sunrise / Broward | Matthew James Carbonell • 305‑764‑2999

1) Warm opener

  • “Thanks for the time. What made you curious about improving the home today?”
  • Listen hard. Mirror and label the real problem(s).

2) Agenda and time check

  • “Quick walkthrough, options and pricing, then we decide together on next steps. Sound good?”

3) Discovery

  • Pains: drafts, heat, noise, leaks. Goals: comfort, bills, curb appeal.
  • Timeline/budget. Who decides? Prior projects? Pet peeves?

4) Demo: choose product

  • Windows/doors: seals + glass tech → stabilize temps, cut drafts, quiet rooms.
  • Insulation/siding/roofing: thermal/air barrier; durability; hurricane suitability.
  • Solar (if in scope): energy offset; app visibility; roof integration.

5) Proof

  • Before/after stories; simple math ($/month). Cost of waiting (AC strain, moisture).

6) Incentives

  • Mention relevant energy‑efficiency credits where applicable.

7) Close: two choices

  • “Option A tackles the biggest draft points; Option B adds the back bedroom for noise.”
  • “Which solves more of your daily discomfort?”

8) Next step

  • Book install estimate window. Recap scope and confirm follow‑up time.

Quick objection hitters

  • Price: “Aside from investment, does it solve the comfort/noise issue?” → phase scope.
  • Think about it: “Is it scope, timing, or investment?” → soft‑hold time.
  • Other quotes: Align on criteria: materials, warranty, install, financing total cost.
  • No time: “10 minutes for demo + ballpark price; then you decide if it’s worth a full visit.”

60‑second version (door / driveway)

Problem: draft/heat/noise → Proof: glass/seal + quick story → Math: simple monthly → Close: Option A (core) vs B (core+bedroom) → Next: soft‑hold time.
